definition: varying from person to person (idiom); different for each individual
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: To add even more variety, each person has different learning styles and preferences.
sentences.chinese: 學習的方法和偏好也是因人而異。

sentences.english: That probably depends on the person, but smaller networks are probably an important option to consider as well.
sentences.chinese: 因人而異吧，但是小型網絡或許是一個重要選項。

sentences.english: The results will obviously differ for every person.
I suppose the answer to that question will differ from person to person, and from scenario to scenario.
sentences.chinese: 我猜想問題列表會將因人而異，因情形而異。

sentences.english: And those changes, he said, vary from person to person.
sentences.chinese: 修特爾說這些能力因人而異。

sentences.english: The percentage varies from person to person. It depends on their salaries.
sentences.chinese: 這一比率因人而異，取決於各人的工資數。

sentences.english: like any other human capacity, differs across people.
sentences.chinese: 就像人類其他的能力一樣，都是因人而異的。

sentences.english: Since individual architectonic knowledge is different, cognition result vary with each individual.
sentences.chinese: 由於個體知識結構的差異，認知結果因人而異。

sentences.english: This varies in degrees for everyone, but we all have little things we can start out with.
sentences.chinese: 這因人而異，但每天總有一些我們能開始做的事情。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
